intro: Lomatogonium rotatum f. typicum, commonly known as the narrowleaf lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a silvery or grayish underside, aiding in water conservation. The flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters, and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
